Stobart''' (born 1929 <ref>[http://www.eladvertiser.co.uk/millom-celebrates-ve-day-with-action-1.404247?referrerPath=home/search_results_2_3314 Millom celebrates VE Day with action...]. eladvertiser.co.uk. 11 August 2005</ref> to parents John and Adelaide) is a British businessman who started an agriculture business in the late 1940s. This became ''Eddie Stobart Ltd'' in 1970, expanded to a haulage company during the 1970s with the help of his late son [[Edward Stobart]] who gradually took over the running of the company during the 1970s and 1980s, and then became a multi-modal logistics public company the [[Stobart Group]] in 2007 under the control of another son [[William Stobart]]. He married Nora Boyd on 26 December 1951 and they live in [[Cumbria]]. They had four children: Anne (1952–), John (1953–), Edward (1954–2011) and William (1961–). Eddie bought his first lorry (a Guy Invincible four-wheeler truck) second-hand from the local garage in 1960, and had it re-painted in his choice of colours: post-office red and Brunswick green. He took over the collection of [[basic slag]] (a waste product of steelworks used as fertiliser) when local company ''Harrison Ivinson'' went out of business, and purchased two Ford Thames Trader trucks which were also painted in his favourite colours with his logo on the doors. A contract with [[Imperial Chemical Industries|ICI]] for storage of basic slag in 1963 enabled expansion of the business, and it became a limited company: ''Eddie Stobart Ltd'' in November 1970 with a share value of ten thousand pounds.<ref>Noel Davidson (1998). ''Only the Best will do: The Eddie Stobart Story'', pages 76, 88 and 124. Ambassador, ISBN 184030043.</ref> Eddie continued to run the company until 1976, when son Edward took over running the transport side, but father Eddie continued to be involved, and retained his own separate warehouse until 1989, when he handed over full control to his sons Edward and William, retaining the title of non-executive chairman of ''Eddie Stobart Ltd'' until December 1992. Eddie's son William retains the family involvement in the business in his position as [[Chief Operating Officer]] of the [[Stobart Group]]. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Stobart, Eddie | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Businessperson | DATE OF BIRTH = 1929 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Cumbria]], England | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Stobart, Eddie}} [[Category:1929 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Cumbria]] [[Category:British businesspeople in shipping]] {{UK-bio-stub}}
